title: Setup Project Structure and Development Environment
description: Establish the foundational project structure including directory layout, version control setup, and development environment configuration for the Multi-Tenant Appointment Booking System. This task includes setting up the repository structure, development tools, and initial configuration files.

effort_estimate.justification: Setting up a comprehensive project structure with proper directory organization, version control, and initial tooling takes approximately half a day for experienced developers.

user_stories: As a developer, I want a well-organized project structure so that I can easily navigate and locate files
As a team member, I need consistent development environments so that we can collaborate effectively
business_rules: All project files must follow a standardized naming convention
Repository structure must align with the microservices architecture approach
Development environment must include necessary tools and dependencies
edge_cases: Ensure compatibility with different operating systems (Windows, macOS, Linux)
Handle potential conflicts with existing project files
Maintain backward compatibility with previous versions

acceptance_criteria: Repository structure is established with proper directories for services
Version control initialized with appropriate branching strategy
Development environment configuration files are in place
Initial commit with baseline project structure is completed
Documentation for project structure is created

additional_context.technical_notes: Follow the monorepo approach with individual service directories. Ensure the structure supports future microservice expansion.
additional_context.design_references: Refer to the Architecture HLD document for the overall system design
additional_context.security_considerations: Ensure proper file permissions and sensitive data handling in configuration files
